snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio wants state officials to approve a tax on the rich to pay for prekindergarten classes, but Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo wants to cut taxes.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio wants state officials to approve a tax on the rich to pay for prekindergarten classes, but Gov Andrew M Cuomo wants to cut taxes; two hold dueling news conferences offering vivid portrait of what promises to be 2014's most intriguing political showdown; upstart mayor and up-for-re-election governor, Democratic colleagues, may end up on sharply different sides of the issue.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio wants state officials to approve a tax on the rich to pay for prekindergarten classes, but Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo wants to cut taxes.

headline.main: Clash of Priorities Sets Up Cuomo-de Blasio Showdown on Pre-K Push
headline.print_headline: Clash of Priorities Sets Up de Blasio-Cuomo Showdown on Pre-K Push
